description:
MacElmons Pond is definately the place to take a first time paddler. For flat water canoeing and kayaking, it's non-intimidating locale that contains a few nice features to paddle around. It has a small island with a narrow channel to paddle through, and an area on the opposite bank where the trail edges the shore, and you can pause and tie up for a snack.
On my visit there, when we were staying at Irwin Lake Chalets,  it was windy enough to only warrent a bit of time in the canoe when we were there. After a hike on the trail, we got the canoe in the water. with nice firm banks, the dog hopped in with little trepedation, and we were off for only a small loop around the inner third of the pond. 
After that, we racked up the boat and headed for home!
shannon Burt
East Coast editor
directions: Off the 102 highway heading North, take exit 14A toward Onslow, (to the left) This is route 2. Take this until you reach a lit intersection with MacAlmons Road to the right. Follow the road for a minute or two until you reach the park on your left.
title: MacElmon's Pond
